snippet: Major parts of the social safety net are rarely repealed after taking effect. The Supreme Court will consider whether to do so with the health law.
abstract: The Upshot; Supreme Court, in hearing case King v Burwell challenging Affordable Care Act's subsidies for residents of states that did not set up insurance exchanges, could potentially accomplish largest rollback of social safety net in America's history; possibility is fraught with implications given that court is now more partisan than it ever has been.
lead_paragraph: Major parts of the social safety net are rarely repealed after taking effect. The Supreme Court will consider whether to do so with the health law.

headline.print_headline: A Polarized Court Weighs a Reversal of the Safety Net
headline.main: A Polarized Court, Weighing a Reversal of the Safety Net

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
